name: (The Fly) Pater Familias [BETA]
description:
There was an old lady who swallowed a fly

I don’t know why she swallowed a fly

Perhaps she’ll die

WARNING: AS ILLUSTRATED IN THE TRANSLATION OF Ba‘al Zəbûb TO “LORD OF THE FLIES” MYTHOLOGICAL TRADITIONS HAVE CONSISTENTLY PLACED FLIES IN RELATION TO THE AFTERLIFE, OBSERVING HOW THEY COALESCE AROUND THE RECENTLY DECEASED. SIMULTANEOUSLY FLIES WERE BELIEVED TO ACT AS A VEHICLE FOR SOULS IN THE PROCESS OF REINCARNATION. SUPERSTITION THEREFORE ARROSE THAT A WOMAN COULD CONCEIVE BY WAY OF SWALLOWING A FLY. IN AGGRESSIVELY PATRIARCHAL SOCIETIES, THE PRACTICE OF CASTRATION EMERGED OUT OF EFFORTS TO OBTAIN THE FEMALE LIFE-GIVING POTENTIAL RELATED TO SACRED BLEEDING WITH THE SIMULTANEOUS OBJECTIVE OF CONTROLLING THE MALE POPULATION AND CONSOLIDATING THE POWER OF THE PATER FAMILIAS. THIS PROMPTED AN OVERARCHING CASTRATION-ANXIETY AMONGST THE BROTHERS.
